title: Bull run back? User spends $113K in gas to snipe token only to be ‘rugged’
description:
A crypto user spent $113,000 in gas in an apparent attempt to snipe the launch of a new ERC-404 token, which pumped and dumped to zero just 35 minutes later.

In typical bull-run fashion, a crypto user has just been spotted spending a staggering $113,000 in gas fees in an attempt to purchase $26,000 worth of a newly launched token.

Unfortunately for them, the token was seemingly "rugged" no more than 35 minutes later.

According to transaction data from Etherscan, a single wallet address interacted with a smart contract address on Feb. 13, transferring 10 ETH (worth approximately $26,000) to the contract. 

Read more

title: Ark’s Cathie Wood says SEC probably will only approve BTC and ETH ETFs
description:
Cathie Wood, CIO and CEO of Ark Invest, told the Wall Street Journal on Feb. 13 that she expects regulators to approve ETFs for very few cryptocurrencies. During the Wall Street Journal’s “Take On the Week” podcast, Wood said: “We’d be surprised to see anything but bitcoin and ether being approved by the [U.S. Securities […]

The post Ark’s Cathie Wood says SEC probably will only approve BTC and ETH ETFs appeared first on CryptoSlate.

title: Bitcoin Has Become World’s ‘Most Popular Investment Asset,’ Says Microstrategy Chairman
description: Microstrategy’s executive chairman, Michael Saylor, has explained why bitcoin has become “the world’s most popular investment asset.” He noted that following the rebalancing after the launch of spot bitcoin exchange-traded funds (ETFs), the crypto has “found its footing and now people are beginning to realize that there’s 10 times as much demand for bitcoin coming […]
